intro: Xyris coutensis, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which is part of the family Xyridaceae, commonly referred to as the yellow-eyed grass family. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its preference for moist environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with three petals and three sepals, forming a distinctive and attractive inflorescence. Xyris coutensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in sunny, wetland conditions.
